meanings.sent1: The ronins were skilled warriors who served no lord.
meanings.sent2: In ancient Japan, ronins were respected for their loyalty and bravery.
meanings.sent3: The ronins decided to start their own dojo and teach others the way of the sword.
meanings.sent4: The ronins' code of honor was their guiding light in a world of chaos.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ronins walking alone, their swords at their sides, was both haunting and inspiring.

meanings.definition: A person who is wandering or without a home.
meanings.sent1: The kind-hearted villagers offered food and shelter to the ronins.
meanings.sent2: The ronins traveled from town to town, seeking a place to call home.
meanings.sent3: The ronins' constant wandering led to many interesting encounters on their journey.
meanings.sent4: In a world full of settled people, the ronins were like free spirits, untethered by walls or roofs.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the ronins under the starry sky, their campfire flickering, was a picture of nomadic beauty.
